features.name: AWS Organizations
features.awsDefinition: A centralized cloud account management service that lets you consolidate multiple AWS accounts into an organization that you create and centrally manage.

features.name: AWS Control Tower
features.description: Landing zone setup and governance with guardrails
features.awsDefinition: A service that offers a straightforward way to set up and govern an AWS multi-account environment, following prescriptive best practices. Orchestrates AWS Organizations, Service Catalog, and IAM Identity Center.

features.name: Control Tower Custom Extensions
features.description: Advanced Control Tower customizations and extensions
features.awsDefinition: Advanced customizations for Control Tower including declarative policies, enhanced hook management, and custom account vending capabilities for enterprise environments.

features.name: IAM Users and Groups
features.description: Basic identity and access management with IAM policies
features.awsDefinition: Manage access to AWS services and resources securely with IAM, using users, groups, and policies.

features.name: AWS IAM Identity Center
features.description: Centralized identity management and single sign-on
features.awsDefinition: Provides workforce identity federation and SSO across AWS accounts and applications with support for permission sets, SAML, and external identity providers.

features.name: VPN Connectivity
features.description: Network connectivity between on-premises and AWS
features.awsDefinition: Provides a secure, private network connection between your on-premises environment and AWS using IPsec VPN tunnels.

features.name: AWS Transit Gateway
features.description: Central network hub for VPC and on-premises connectivity
features.awsDefinition: A network transit hub that simplifies inter-VPC and hybrid cloud networking by connecting VPCs and on-premises networks.

features.name: AWS Direct Connect
features.awsDefinition: Establishes a dedicated, high-bandwidth, low-latency connection between your datacenter and AWS.

features.name: AWS Network Firewall
features.awsDefinition: A stateful, managed firewall service for VPCs that provides deep packet inspection and intrusion prevention.

features.name: Amazon GuardDuty
features.awsDefinition: A threat detection service that continuously monitors AWS accounts and workloads for malicious activity using AI/ML.

features.name: AWS Security Hub
features.awsDefinition: Aggregates and prioritizes security alerts from multiple AWS services, offering continuous compliance checks.

features.name: Amazon Inspector
features.awsDefinition: Scans AWS workloads for software vulnerabilities and unintended network exposure.

features.name: Amazon Macie
features.awsDefinition: A data security and privacy service that uses ML to discover, classify, and protect sensitive data in AWS.

features.name: AWS CloudTrail
features.description: Audit and governance through event logging
features.awsDefinition: Enables governance, compliance, and operational auditing by recording AWS account activity.

features.name: Amazon CloudWatch
features.description: Monitoring and observability for AWS resources
features.awsDefinition: Collects and tracks metrics, collects log files, and monitors AWS resources in real-time.

features.name: Amazon OpenSearch Service (for Logging)
features.awsDefinition: A managed service that makes it easy to deploy, operate, and scale OpenSearch for log analytics and search.

features.name: AWS Budgets
features.awsDefinition: Allows you to set custom cost and usage budgets with alerts via email or SNS.

features.name: AWS Cost Explorer
features.awsDefinition: Enables you to view and analyze your AWS cost and usage patterns through reports and dashboards.

features.name: AWS Backup
features.awsDefinition: Automates and centrally manages backups across AWS services with policy-based backup plans.

features.name: AWS Audit Manager
features.awsDefinition: Helps you continuously audit AWS usage to simplify risk and compliance management.
